body: This reproduces with bazel version set to `7.0.0rc2`
You are passing a dict from strings to tuples to `sdk`, but that's not a supported attribute type. Instead, you should pass a dict from strings to lists. But yes, Bazel shouldn't crash in this case.
I see, so we should also probably adjust the `sdks` [README example](https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_go/blob/master/go/toolchains.rst#go_download_sdk), which uses tuples

issue.title: Support lockfile serialization of Starlark tuples in MODULE.bazel files

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

body: Actually, I do see the semantic appeal of this now and if BUILD files support this and it's reasonably simple to add support for MODULE.bazel files, then why not. We need to handle the crash in some way anyway. I submitted https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/20129.

body: A fix for this issue has been included in[Bazel 7.0.0 RC5](https://releases.bazel.build/7.0.0/rc5/index.html). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible. Thanks!
